text:
Hello.

We use HubSpot LiveChat and ,In the mobile version we would like the live chat to not appear but be in the sticky toolbar as a button and only appear when a customer clicks on it. We have it with another provider integrated into our website, the screenshot of the example is attached.

To do so, our team of developers will take care of the full process, but the code provided to us is not enough to do it. Is there a chance someone could provide us with the full code that will enable this requirement?

Thanks in advance.
is there some way I can fetch the properties that are visible in the ticket creation form in HubSpot from the api?

Hi guys, sorry to be a pain, but we'd really need a meeting with technical people to understand really how we can sort out this big issue. When could we have this meeting? It's quite urgent to be honest, I'd be happy to have it tomorrow if possible. Thanks

Under <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/associations>
it shows the following:

What I would suggest, is looking at the associations linked to tickets under settings > objects > tickets > associations, check if there are any linked associations there, and click edit. Inside the URL, you can see the association IDs linked to this specific one
If this doesn't help, I would suggest finding the associations, using the API call described above

Over here you have the old id's, but I think the list got a bit longer
<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/crm-associations/crm-associations-overview>

Thanks Arno for your reply.
But what I don't understand which is the difference between a ticket-conversation association type 32 and another with type 278
What is the difference in the conversations?
As in, if you would put them next to each other, where does it differ
When I run this <https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v4/objects/ticket/TicketID/associations/conversation>
Y get
as you can see, I get 3 from typeID 32 and 3 for type 278
and in the ticket I only see 3 conversations
This might be Ticket > Conversation and Conversation > Ticket
the toObjectId, could you check on those to which ticket / conversation they link

I am running a get method <https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v4/objects/ticket/TicketID/associations/conversation>
to I expected ticket - conversation, where the object id is from a conversation
Or am i missunderstanding something
Not sure, as I haven't worked with connection between conversations, but might have to do something with that
I would check with changing the ID in the url when on a converstation / ticket and see which one exists and so on

Thanks Arno.
<@U01QVR44MEY> Could you please help me with that? Thanks in advance

Hello guys i have created an end point for control component button
it is making some update in portal but after some time it is showing error
```Action failed.
Wait a few minutes and try again or contact the app provider for more info.```
can anyone tell me what type of return i need to add at my end in order to remove this error?

Hello Guys, I need some help in public app. Webhook URL not working in the app. But the same URL working in postman. Its giving an error 405 method not allowed. Can anyone let me know what was the issue. Thanks
do you have the webhook setup to support POST requests?
Yes. Am using laravel API function.
In postman its working
<@U046C9LKJP8> just fyi the conversation and other engagements won't populate in the settings tab for a particular object. The only way to pull it is through the api.
<@U049WTE7AEB> The associations with the id of 32 is the one you'll want to use it's the 1 conversation to many tickets.
The 278 association is a new thing that the team is testing (doesn't work yet I don't think) called TICKET_TO_CONVERSATION_V2 (one to one (which is not smart))
tldr: you don't need to worry about any of the 278 conversations just the 32 ones
Might be handy that it also shows in the settings tab then. Also quite annoying that I can't find a full list of IDs like the url I shared of the old API

Oh. Sounds good. 
If we implement our solution with the 31 could be arise any trouble in the future when 278 is live?
no it will be backwards compatible
The UI one? or the HubSpot forms one?
is this for a CRM card? And if so is it a developer project card?
Is the app fully install on the account? does it show in the connected app section?
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C22PU4LV8/p1680502741307199>
Hi <@U01QVR44MEY> just wanted to follow up on this
The UI one - basically I want to fetch all fields that are required / optional for when creating a ticket via the UI, while also knowing which are required / optional.
Unfortunately that form is internal and can't be accessed through the api. Only the forms created through the forms tool (or api) can be accessed through the api
I'm interested though, why would you want to do this?

<@U04NES57R0D> Thanks for following up. You are correct you can only read properties and not associations when using the batch endpoint. You can read bulk read the associations for a particular object type using the associations api:
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/associations>
we're trying to create a form for creating tickets in HubSpot, but the form definition should be fetched dynamically

otherwise we'd have to make code changes all the time to align with the ticket creaton form..

how does the HubSpot slack integration mirror the ticket creation form from a HubSpot instance?

• in a new app  i had added a custom setting
• inside custom setting created a new control component (Button)
• inside button configuration i called an end point with POST request
• on click of that button it is calling the function and changes from that function are also reflecting in HubSpot end
but later error also coming
hey folks! cross-posting here in case this is the more appropriate channel, i wasn’t sure: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/CBA9UA4EN/p1680548450947939>
